## PHYSICS  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[832, 276, 905, 292]]<|/det|>
0625/42  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 300, 299, 316]]<|/det|>
Paper 4 Theory (Extended)  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[707, 300, 905, 316]]<|/det|>
October/November 2020  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[760, 325, 905, 341]]<|/det|>
1 hour 15 minutes  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 355, 395, 371]]<|/det|>
You must answer on the question paper.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 383, 359, 399]]<|/det|>
No additional materials are needed.  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 418, 230, 434]]<|/det|>
## INSTRUCTIONS  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 435, 808, 574]]<|/det|>
INSTRUCTIONS- Answer all questions.- Use a black or dark blue pen. You may use an HB pencil for any diagrams or graphs.- Write your name, centre number and candidate number in the boxes at the top of the page.- Write your answer to each question in the space provided.- Do not use an erasable pen or correction fluid.- Do not write on any bar codes.- You may use a calculator.- You should show all your working and use appropriate units.- Take the weight of \(1.0 \text{kg}\) to be \(10 \text{N}\) (acceleration of free fall \(= 10 \text{m/s}^2\)).  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 603, 220, 618]]<|/det|>
## INFORMATION  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 619, 730, 651]]<|/det|>
INFORMATION- The total mark for this paper is 80.- The number of marks for each question or part question is shown in brackets [ ].

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 72, 620, 89]]<|/det|>
The angle between the rod and the vertical is increased.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 102, 920, 135]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 72, 920, 106]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 117, 507, 135]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[487, 303, 920, 322]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 241, 920, 274]]<|/det|>
Radioactive tracers emitting \(\gamma\) -rays can be used in medicine. The half-life of the source of these \(\gamma\) -rays is 6 hours.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 288, 181, 306]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[191, 288, 920, 320]]<|/det|>
Explain why a source of \(\gamma\) -rays used in this way should not have a half-life shorter or longer than about 6 hours.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 427, 920, 444]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 458, 181, 476]]<|/det|>
<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 457, 920, 507]]<|/det|>
Technetium-99 is a source of \(\gamma\) -rays often used as a radioactive tracer. It is produced from molybdenum-99 which emits \(\beta\) -particles. The symbol for technetium is Tc and the symbol for molybdenum is Mo.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 520, 567, 538]]<|/det|>
Complete the nuclide equation for this decay.

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[272, 548, 527, 579]]<|/det|>
\[\frac{99}{42}\mathrm{Mo}\rightarrow \dots \dots \mathrm{TC} + \dots \beta\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 572, 920, 590]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[144, 603, 180, 621]]<|/det|>
<label>(iii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 603, 512, 621]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 634, 630, 651]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[843, 720, 920, 738]]<|/det|>
